chapter.title: Introduction
chapter.para: Tapestry is an application framework for developing web applications. It uses a component object model to represent the pages of a web application. This is similar to spirit to using the Java Swing component object model to build GUIs.

This tutorial exists to help newcomers quickly understand Tapestry.

section.title: Working with Tapestry
section.para: The goal of Tapestry is to eliminate most of the coding in a web application. Under Tapestry, nearly all code is directly related to application functionality, with very little "plumbing". If you have previously developed a web application using Microsoft Active Server Pages, JavaServer Pages or Java Servlets, you may take for granted all the plumbing: writing servlets, assembling URLs, parsing URLs, managing objects inside the &HttpSession;, etc.
